page.title: 13ECOLOGICAL SURVEY
page.content: This was carried out in May 1985 in the central part of Oldbury. This area included a school playing field and an area which was awaiting development. Identification of many specimens was quite straightforward but some presented problems due to their underdevelopment following the late cold spring. In total some 41 different plants were found, of which 36 were positively identified and 5 were loosely identified. List: Bush Vetch, Burdock, Honesty, Groundsel, Black Mustard, Broad-leafed dock, Scentless Mayweed, Coltsfoot, Ribwart, Hoary Plantain, Mugwort, Black Medic, Oxford Ragwort, Rosebay Willowherb, White Deadnettle, Bramble, Sheep's Sorrel, Red Clover, White Clover, Creeping Buttercup, Dandelion, Wild Pansey, Yarrow and Sunsprung etc.
